newsitem.title: GERMANY: Forwarders seek joint air cargo products with airl.
newsitem.headline: Forwarders seek joint air cargo products with airl.

text.p: A new era of co-operation between forwarders and airlines is needed to offer better air cargo services to shippers, the German forwarders' association BSL said.
Wolf-Dietrich von Helldoff, BSL air cargo committee chairman, said forwarders should drop their traditional distrust of airlines and work more closely with them to create joint products

The traditional roles of forwarder and airline were changing as communications technology made the market more transparent and broke down barriers between their activities, he told air cargo journalists in a BSL briefing.
"We will have a new division of roles but what is important is that we create and develop joint products.
If we want to present a joint product to the shipper, then we must create the product together. We cannot do that alone, nor can the airline do it alone," he stressed.
"When we talk about the development of strategic new markets, then joint discussions on planning, budgets, volumes, freighter schedules and all these things should belong to it.

"Today each airline decides for itself. I have never been asked by an airline where I see the strategic development for the future, where freighter will develop and where capacity will be needed. This is anachronistic," he noted.
In future, forwarders with sufficient volume would increasingly buy up air cargo space, guarantee space to clients and pay airlines dead freight fees for no-shows, von Helldorif forecast.

This capacity block-purchasing gave forwarders guaranteed departure times, cheaper rates and more flexibility but also meant a higher risk and extra costs through the payment of no-show fees. he added.
Von Helldorff said the airline cargo rates were already transparent to shippers and forwarders had to convince shippers to pay extra for added-value services such as transport guarantees.
"The big shippers already get the same rates as the top forwarders. The rates question is not a taboo for me," he said.

As a forwarder I must demonstrate my service so that the shipper is ready to pay for it. The market will become more transparent," he added. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017 - www.racs.com
